I'm trying to set up a flight stick for use in KSP.  I'm using a T.Master HOTAS X, and I can't seem to get KSP to work correctly.  The sensitivity is just way too high despite me lowering sensitivities, and I have a few other issues.

 

The throttle is also at half max while my throttle is in neutral position.  I'm guessing I need to change the dead zone for this, but how far?  

Also, is there a way to set button combinations for actions?  (Such as setting map to joy 1 + thumb axis left?)  Thanks

Edited April 14, 2018 by maxerature
I figured out basic stuff, but not everything.
@maxerature I got a T.Flight Hotas X yesterday, gonna set it up and try it out tonight. Been playing with mouse and keyboard so I imagine its going to take some getting used to.

Does anyone know if this is supported on console? I  have a thrustmaster  flight stick for  elite dangerous. 

Would be epic to use it when docking/building stations( Pretty much my favourite thing to do in the game)

Never thought about using it for ksp until I saw this discussion.
